title: The neighbour's bull: learning from animal breeding practices in Nicaragua

tasks.task: Conducting a livestock breeding workshop in Nicaragua with farmers.
subtasks: Introduction of the International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI) and their goals in livestock genetics.
Understanding the livestock systems in Nicaragua, including dual-purpose cattle for milk and meat production.
Identifying local breeds and crossbreeds observed in the early baseline surveys.
Organizing group discussions with male farmers to discuss preferred traits and current breeding practices.
Observing farmer selection of animals based on physical characteristics rather than breeding records.
Addressing the infrequent use of artificial insemination (AI) by male farmers and the reasons behind it.
Recognizing the curiosity and interest of female livestock keepers in learning about AI and breeding techniques.
Planning a separate workshop for female farmers to train them in reproduction management and AI usage.
